Package GameOfLife

Class MiniBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameOfLife.MiniBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Callable<byte[][]>
    public class MiniBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Callable<byte[][]>
    The MIniBoard class will create instances of miniboards. Miniboard objects will contain their starting and ending x and y coordinates. This class is creating to split the grid up into the number of threads that were chosen. This class also implements Callable so the miniboard threads can be run simultaneously.

      MiniBoard​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      The miniboard constructor creates an instance of the MiniBoard class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MiniBoard

        public MiniBoard​(int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2)
        The miniboard constructor creates an instance of the MiniBoard class. The function uses the paramters to create the object which will then be used to run a single thread for this sumulaton.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the starting x position
        y1 - the starting y position
        x2 - the ending x position
        y2 - the ending y position

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        public static int getIndex​(int num,
                           int mod)
        The function below is responsible for calculating the desired index. This function is used to account for "wrapping around" the board
        Parameters:
        num - the index the user is looking for
        mod - the number of rows/columns in the grid
        Returns:
        returns the index and accounts for wrapping around the grid.

      • call

        public byte[][] call()
        The call function is used to run each thread of the simulation. It will take a byte[][], which represents a miniboard, and will update the state of each cell in that board.
        Specified by:
        call in interface java.util.concurrent.Callable<byte[][]>
        Returns:
        newB the updated miniboard.
